item.title: Senior Animal Production/Health Specialist (Cat I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance Support to the Ministry of Agriculture in the Area of Livestock Development

The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the reduction of poverty by creating pro-poor growth, securing livelihoods of small holder farmers and providing locally produced diversified food on the market. The purpose of the contract is to support the Ministry of Agriculture in developing a sound intervention in the livestock sector as part of the 11th EDF, focussing on rangeland based smallholder livestock development.

Candidates with experience working in the SADC region are preferable.

Senior Animal Production/Health Specialist (Cat I)

  • At least a Masters Degree in livestock science, animal science, agriculture, animal production and health or closely related field; alternatively, a basic degree in a relevant area with at least 5 years additional experience above the professional experience indicated below;
  • Minimally twelve years proven experience in the field of expertise, of which minimally five years’ experience in cattle/livestock production systems, with emphasis on animal nutrition.
  • Strong, proven experience in development of smallholder production;
  • Sound knowledge of animal health aspects of livestock development;
  • Fluency in both written and spoken English is essential.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Lina_Forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Rangeland Management Specialist (Cat I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance Support to the Ministry of Agriculture in the Area of Livestock Development

The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the reduction of poverty by creating pro-poor growth, securing livelihoods of small holder farmers and providing locally produced diversified food on the market. The purpose of the contract is to support the Ministry of Agriculture in developing a sound intervention in the livestock sector as part of the 11th EDF, focussing on rangeland based smallholder livestock development.

Candidates with experience working in the SADC region are preferable.

Rangeland Management Specialist (Cat I)

  • At least a Masters Degree in natural resource management, agriculture, environmental science or closely related field; alternatively, a basic degree in a relevant area with at least 5 years additional experience above the professional experience indicated below;
  • Minimally twelve years proven experience in the field of expertise, of which minimally five years’ experience in rangeland management
  • Strong, proven networks in international markets;
  • Excellent negotiation skills are required;
  • Proven training skills and a proven track record in imparting knowledge and skills;
  • Proven experience in international trade environment including tariff and non-tariff barriers to trade, accreditation schemes, and international logistics arrangements for fresh produce;
  • Fluency in both written and spoken English is essential;

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Lina_Forgeaux@dai.com

item.title: Team leader – International Livestock Development Expert (Cat I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance Support to the Ministry of Agriculture in the Area of Livestock Development

The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the reduction of poverty by creating pro-poor growth, securing livelihoods of small holder farmers and providing locally produced diversified food on the market. The purpose of the contract is to support the Ministry of Agriculture in developing a sound intervention in the livestock sector as part of the 11th EDF, focussing on rangeland based smallholder livestock development.

Candidates with experience working in the SADC region are preferable.

Team leader – International Livestock Development Expert (Cat I)

  • At least a Masters Degree in agriculture, agricultural economics, livestock science or closely related field; alternatively, a basic degree in a relevant area with at least 5 years additional experience above the professional experience indicated below;
  • Minimally twelve years proven experience in the field of expertise, agriculture and livestock development of which minimally seven years in the development of smallholder livestock development preferably in sub-Sahara Africa;
  • Sound understanding of and experience in livestock marketing;
  • Proven experience in international trade environment including tariff and non-tariff barriers to trade,
  • Excellent analytical skills and strategic planning skills;
  • Strong, proven team leadership/management skills;
  • Fluency in both written and spoken English is essential;

item.title: Senior Social Development and Gender Expert (Team Leader)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Gender Analysis for Thailand and Malaysia

Global objective The gender analysis will provide an understanding whether gender inequalities persist in Thailand and Malaysia and its causes, how it intersects with other inequalities, how it impacts on human rights enjoyment and/or benefits produced by and access to development efforts as well as an understanding of partner governments’ commitment and capacity to work on GEWE issues.

Requested services The gender analyse should provide qualitative information, sex-age disaggregated data and analysis on the gender situation in the country/sector in order to contribute to the political/policy dialogue and facilitate the development of gender-sensitive country strategies as well as programmes and projects throughout the whole PPCM cycle.

Senior Social Development and Gender Expert (Team Leader) 33 working days

Qualifications and skills

  • Advanced university degree (Minimum Master) in in development studies, social development, gender studies certified by a Diploma (or equivalent professional experience of at least 15 years if candidate does not possess an advance university degree.)
  • Demonstrated writing and communication skills;
  • Computer literacy (minimum MS Word, Excel).

General professional experience

  • A minimum of twelve years’ experience in social development and gender analysis;
  • Specific experience and expertise on gender analysis, gender mainstreaming and women’s participation;
  • Extensive experience working on national gender policies in developing countries;
  • Experience of working in South East Asia and preferably in Thailand and Malaysia is essential,;
  • Organisational development and capacity building experience;
  • Knowledge of international/regional agreements and initiatives on gender (UN, CEDAW, Beijing, etc.)
  • Demonstrated experience in managing a team of experts;
  • Up-to-date and comprehensive knowledge and experience of EU development, policies, instruments and facilities.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Two Cat.III Gender Experts
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Gender Analysis for Thailand and Malaysia

Global objective The gender analysis will provide an understanding whether gender inequalities persist in Thailand and Malaysia and its causes, how it intersects with other inequalities, how it impacts on human rights enjoyment and/or benefits produced by and access to development efforts as well as an understanding of partner governments’ commitment and capacity to work on GEWE issues.

Requested services The gender analyse should provide qualitative information, sex-age disaggregated data and analysis on the gender situation in the country/sector in order to contribute to the political/policy dialogue and facilitate the development of gender-sensitive country strategies as well as programmes and projects throughout the whole PPCM cycle.

Two Gender Experts Cat III (2*15 or 30 working days).

The Category III experts can either be a single person or two different people each responsible for a country. Please note that the Evaluation Committee will evaluate the expert(s) Cat III CV(s) as well as the Expert Cat I CV(s) in its evaluation.

Qualifications and skills

  • University degree certified by a Diploma (or equivalent professional experience of at least 5 years if candidate(s) do not possess a university diploma)
  • Good communication skills, both oral and written; ** Computer literacy (minimum MS Word, Excel, MIS). General professional experience
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in the context of gender and development (this can include consultancy on gender development programmes as well as more academic works such as gender related studies etc.);

  • Knowledge of the development and gender context of Thailand and Malaysia.

  • Knowledge of development and gender context in South East Asia would be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Two Agriculture/Rural Development Experts with Food Safety or Veterinary/Animal Health Experience
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of the EU-funded Support to Agriculture and Rural Development under IPA I

Global objective

The primary objective of this project is to evaluate to which extent the EU assistance provided under the IPA programmes 2007-2013 (IPA I) in the areas of agriculture, rural development, food safety and animal health/veterinary has reached its objectives.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objective of this assignment is to evaluate the achievements under the IPA programmes 2007-2013 (IPA I) in the areas of agriculture, rural development, food safety and animal health/veterinary and inform on the factors behind success or failure of this assistance and their geographical (urban/rural) and gender distribution.

Two Agriculture/Rural Development Experts with Food Safety or Veterinary/Animal Health Experience

Qualification and skills

Master degree in agriculture/economic/veterinary/health/business administration/ biology/ geography/ statistics; or a bachelor degree in agriculture/ economic/ veterinary/ health/ business administration/ biology/ geography/ statistics and 5 years professional experience (in addition to the minimum number of years of general professional experience required below).

General professional experience

  • Minimum 6 years, preferably 10 years of experience in the field of agriculture and/or rural development and/or food safety and/or veterinary/animal health.

Specific professional experience

  • Experience as evaluation expert in minimum one project, preferably three projects aimed at evaluating EU programmes financed under EU pre-accession assistance in the field of agriculture and/or rural development and/or food safety and/or veterinary/animal health.

The minimum number of working days for the two experts altogether is 100 working days.

Both experts should be proficient in English language and have very good reporting and communication skills.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Experto Categoría III – Informático
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
ATI MMAyA 2016-17

El contrato tiene como objetivo general apoyar al MMAYA en la implementación de los programas actuales así como en la fase de preparación de un Nuevo Convenio de Financiación (CF) Sectorial y el Programas de Asistencia Técnica al MMAyA. El asesoramiento se producirá a través de la provisión de estudios, metodologías, etc.

Project location: La Paz, misiones a las potenciales zonas de intervención: Santa Cruz, Tarija, Cochabamba, Beni, Pando y Oruro

Experto Categoría III – Informático

Preparación y calificaciones

  • Formación académica en los rubros de informática, ingeniería, geografía o cualquier otro tipo de diploma científico;
  • Competencia en manejo de bases de datos Postgres/PostGIS, relacional y sistemas de información distribuidos: manejo de los usuarios, configuración y adaptación de la base de datos, desarrollo de funciones y de consultas, carga y exportación de datos, back-ups;
  • Competencia en operaciones básicas de redes informáticas (TCP / IP , VPN, FTP …);
  • Competencia en manejo y mantenimiento del servidor, versionamiento Git, SO LINUX, Windows;
  • Competencia en programación/desarrollo de interfaces web para bases de datos (digitalización de datos y consultas);
  • Competencia deseable en lenguajes de programación y herramientas informáticas (SQL y PHP, HTML. Manejo de Drupal, Javascript, Python)
  • Conocimiento en SIG y datos geoespaciales deseable;
  • Debe hablar y escribir fluidamente en español.

Experiencia profesional

  • Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en programación y /o gestión de sistemas, con la aplicación de las competencias arriba mencionadas;
  • Mínimo 3 años de experiencia laboral en Bolivia, que permita un conocimiento de las condiciones de sistemas informáticos en el país;
  • Experiencia en apoyo a sistemas gubernamentales, y del Ministerio de Medioambiente y Agua en particular, deseable.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Experto Categoría III - Coordinador
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
ATI MMAyA 2016-17

El contrato tiene como objetivo general apoyar al MMAYA en la implementación de los programas actuales así como en la fase de preparación de un Nuevo Convenio de Financiación (CF) Sectorial y el Programas de Asistencia Técnica al MMAyA. El asesoramiento se producirá a través de la provisión de estudios, metodologías, etc.

Project location: La Paz, misiones a las potenciales zonas de intervención: Santa Cruz, Tarija, Cochabamba, Beni, Pando y Oruro

Experto Categoría III - Coordinador:

Preparación y calificaciones

  • Formación académica en los rubros de economía, ciencias sociales o biología.
  • Formación complementaria (postgrado o maestría) es deseable, particularmente en temáticas de desarrollo y/o relacionadas al sector de agua y medioambiente.
  • Debe hablar y escribir fluidamente en español.
  • Debe tener facilidad de comunicación y negociación para relacionarse con autoridades nacionales, subnacionales y organizaciones sociales, competencia intercultural y la predisposición de adaptarse a cambios del entorno institucional con creatividad.

Experiencia profesional general

  • Mínimo de 5 años de experiencia en el sector de agua y medioambiente.
  • Mínimo de 5 años de experiencia laboral en países en vías de desarrollo.
  • Mínimo de 3 años de experiencia laboral con organismos de cooperación (donantes, agencias técnicas, ONGs) en Bolivia.
  • Experiencia demostrada en el desarrollo y/o implementaciones de programas sectoriales, en coordinación con instancias gubernamentales y/o sociales.

Experiencia profesional específica deseable

  • Experiencia en el diseño y/o la implementación de programas de apoyo sectorial, idealmente con la modalidad de apoyo presupuestario de la Unión Europea.
  • Experiencia específica relacionada con políticas de agua, manejo de cuencas, biodiversidad y/o sector forestal.
  • Experiencia en el diseño y/o implementación de programas de fortalecimiento de capacidades.
  • Experiencia en trabajo dentro de o en apoyo a instituciones gubernamentales a nivel central o sub-nacional.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.title: Expert I - Technical Adviser with Experience in a NAO Office
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Short Term Technical Assistance to Support the NAO Office

The overall objective of this assignment is to improve the efficiency and effectiveness with which the EU Assistance to Kenya is implemented

The specific objective is to provide technical assistance to the National Treasury primarily to support coordination of the financial management of EU Grants to County Governments, but also to ensure that the National Treasury performs its role with regards to the administration of Grants as outlined in the PFM Act and PFM Regulations and the Cotonou Partnership Agreement.

Expert I - Technical Adviser with Experience in a NAO Office

Qualifications and Skills

  • A Master’s degree in either of the following disciplines: Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Social Sciences or Public Administration.
  • Excellent command of spoken and written English.

General Professional Experience

  • Minimum of 12 years professional experience in an advisory role either in the public or private sector and/or development financing of which at least 5 years must be in an NAO office
  • Extensive and demonstrated understanding of funding modalities of the European Union
  • Excellent understanding of the current aid architecture (trends in aid policy management, coordination and modes of aid delivery) such as budget support and use of country systems
  • Extensive knowledge of development cooperation and the various instruments of the EU
  • Demonstrated understanding of project cycle management, developing and implementing monitoring framework for donor funded programmes and the respective challenges for Aid Management Specific professional experience
  • At least 5 years work experience in ACP region preferably relevant work experience in a developing country
  • Familiar with public financial programming and decentralised budgeting/financing system
  • Demonstrated Knowledge of EDF procedures particularly financial and procurement procedures , reporting requirements and programming

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Aurelie_Durand@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Category II Expertise in Sociology
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of the Sector Policy Support Programme ‘Promoting mutual trade by removing technical barriers to trade between Ukraine and the European Union’

The specific purpose for undertaking this evaluation is to evaluate the Technical Barriers to Trade in Sector Budget Support according to the standard OECD criteria and finally study the effects of EU-funded cooperation in the area of technical barriers to trade on the business climate in Ukraine and of the perceptions by the business community of the reforms supported by the TBT SBS and other EU-funded programmes on the subject.

As a matter of fact, systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes, activities, instruments, legislation and non-spending activities is a priority of the European Commission in order to demonstrate accountability and to promote lesson learning to improve policy and practice.

The generic purpose of the evaluation is to identify key lessons and to produce recommendations to improve current and inform future choices on the sector reform contracts in Ukraine and on the cooperation between the EU in Ukraine in the sphere of the removal of technical barriers in the trade in industrial goods.

Project duration: 130 days (until May 2017)

Category II Expertise in Sociology – 45 working days

Qualifications and skills

  • Master’s degree in a field related to the assignment – economic, social or legal sciences - or at least extra 5 years of experience additional to that described below under the general professional experience;
  • Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written.
  • Knowledge of Ukrainian (or Russian) would be a very strong asset;

General Professional experience

  • at least 6 years of relevant professional experience in sociology;
  • professional experience in development cooperation will be an asset;

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 2 years of practical experience in designing, implementation and analysis of sociological polls;
  • Practical experience in application of the focus groups tool.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Category I Expertise in Technical Barriers to Trade
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of the Sector Policy Support Programme ‘Promoting mutual trade by removing technical barriers to trade between Ukraine and the European Union’

The specific purpose for undertaking this evaluation is to evaluate the Technical Barriers to Trade in Sector Budget Support according to the standard OECD criteria and finally study the effects of EU-funded cooperation in the area of technical barriers to trade on the business climate in Ukraine and of the perceptions by the business community of the reforms supported by the TBT SBS and other EU-funded programmes on the subject.

As a matter of fact, systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes, activities, instruments, legislation and non-spending activities is a priority of the European Commission in order to demonstrate accountability and to promote lesson learning to improve policy and practice.

The generic purpose of the evaluation is to identify key lessons and to produce recommendations to improve current and inform future choices on the sector reform contracts in Ukraine and on the cooperation between the EU in Ukraine in the sphere of the removal of technical barriers in the trade in industrial goods.

Project duration: 130 days (until May 2017)

Category I Expertise in Technical Barriers to Trade – 50 working days

Qualifications and skills

  • Master’s degree in a field related to the assignment – economic, legal, financial, international relations, engineering etc. or at least extra 5 years of experience additional to that described below under the general professional experience;
  • be proficient in English (level C1 in reading, speaking and writing);
  • have excellent communication and analytical skills;
  • be capable using modern IT technologies;
  • excellent writing skills;
  • The working knowledge of Ukrainian or Russian (at least level B2) will be an advantage.

General Professional experience

  • at least 12 years of relevant professional experience in the areas of technical regulation and quality infrastructure (non-food products), including standardisation, metrology, conformity assessment, market surveillance or accreditation institutions,;

Specific professional experience:

  • at least 1 year of professional experience in development cooperation;
  • experience in budget support implementation or evaluation would be an asset;
  • Experience in the ENP countries, including Ukraine, will be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.title: Expert Spécialiste des Filières Agricoles CAT II
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mission d'assistance technique aupres du Ministere de l'Agriculture de l'Elevage (Phase transitoire)

L'objectif général de l'intervention est de contribuer à la mise en place d'un partenariat efficace et pertinent entre la République du Bénin et l'Union Européenne pour le développement du secteur agricole et la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle du Bénin. L’objectif particulier consiste à appuyer le Ministère de l’Agriculture, de l’Elevage et de la Pêche (MAEP), dans la conception de la nouvelle stratégie de développement du secteur agricole et de ses modalités de mise en oeuvre et de pilotage.

Expert Spécialiste des Filières Agricoles CAT II – 100 j/h

L'expert doit être titulaire d'un BAC+5 minimum en agronomie, économie rurale ou agricole, sociologie rurale, ou équivalent.

Il doit disposer d'au moins 6 ans d'expérience dans le diagnostic de filières agricoles et les stratégies de développement des filières et la mise en place d'interprofession.

La connaissance de la législation sur les interprofessions en Afrique de l'Ouest est souhaitée.

Il doit disposer d'une bonne connaissance du secteur agricole au Bénin.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert Spécialiste du Financement du Secteur Agricole, CAT I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mission d'assistance technique aupres du Ministere de l'Agriculture de l'Elevage (Phase transitoire)

L'objectif général de l'intervention est de contribuer à la mise en place d'un partenariat efficace et pertinent entre la République du Bénin et l'Union Européenne pour le développement du secteur agricole et la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle du Bénin. L’objectif particulier consiste à appuyer le Ministère de l’Agriculture, de l’Elevage et de la Pêche (MAEP), dans la conception de la nouvelle stratégie de développement du secteur agricole et de ses modalités de mise en oeuvre et de pilotage.

*Expert Spécialiste du Financement du Secteur Agricole, CAT I – 100 j/h * BAC+5 minimum en agronomie, agroéconomie ou équivalent

Le consultant doit disposer d’au moins 12 ans d'expérience dans le développement rural.

Il disposera d'au moins 6 ans d'expérience dans le financement du secteur agricole, avec au moins une expérience réussi d'octroi de subventions publiques et de (micro) crédit dans le monde agricole, au moins une expérience réussie en matière d’ingénierie de formation et l'élaboration de plan de formation basé sur l'analyse des besoins et des profils.

Il doit avoir une très bonne connaissance des institutions de financement du secteur agricole et du secteur agricole au Bénin.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.title: Chef de Mission, Expert des Politiques et Stratégies de Développement Agricole, CAT I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mission d'assistance technique aupres du Ministere de l'Agriculture de l'Elevage (Phase transitoire)

L'objectif général de l'intervention est de contribuer à la mise en place d'un partenariat efficace et pertinent entre la République du Bénin et l'Union Européenne pour le développement du secteur agricole et la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle du Bénin. L’objectif particulier consiste à appuyer le Ministère de l’Agriculture, de l’Elevage et de la Pêche (MAEP), dans la conception de la nouvelle stratégie de développement du secteur agricole et de ses modalités de mise en oeuvre et de pilotage.

Chef de Mission, Expert des Politiques et Stratégies de Développement Agricole, CAT I – 120 j/h

Le chef de mission aura une formation BAC+5 minimum en agronomie, agroéconomie, économie rurale, sociologie rurale ou équivalent avec une expérience générale d’au moins 12 ans dans le développement rural.

Il doit disposer d'au moins 5 ans dans les pays en voie de développement. Il aura une expérience spécifique dans l'élaboration, le suivi et l’évaluation de politiques et de stratégie de développement agricole ainsi que la mise en œuvre de réformes sectorielles dans le secteur agricole.

Une expertise pratique dans les domaines du conseil agricole, de développement des services à l’exploitation agricole, de l’installation des jeunes dans l’agriculture dans des pays en développement sera appréciée.

Il doit disposer d’au moins 6 ans d'expérience dans le domaine des finances rurales et agricoles avec au moins une expérience dans la budgétisation axée sur les résultats ainsi qu'une bonne connaissance de l’ECOWAP/PDDAA, des orientations stratégiques de la CEDEAO et exigences juridiques relatives à l'élaboration de stratégie agricole et mobilisation de ressource.

Une connaissance des procédures de la Commission Européenne constituera un avantage comparatif.

Une connaissance de la problématique du développement rural ou de pays de la sous-région au Bénin est souhaitée.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.title: Value Chain Specialist (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation of the ARISE+ Project

On November 3, 2016, the draft Action Document of ARISE+ will be presented to the Quality Support Group of the European Commission Directorate for Development and Cooperation. Comments received during this consultation will be incorporated in a revised draft Action Document that will be made available to and finalised by the experts. A second Quality Support Group will take place tentatively on March 7, 2017 before a final decision on ARISE+ is reached by Q3 of 2017.

The mission’s main objective is to assist the EU Delegation to Vietnam formulate the ARISE+ Programme in Vietnam with a focus on its support to private sector component.

The mission will identify the list of priorities where the programme’s scarce resources should be allocated. This includes the list of sectors most likely to benefit from support to access markets in the EU, with maximum impact on job creation and poverty reduction.

Value Chain Specialist (Category II) (25 working days)

  • At least a Masters Degree in Economics, Business, Trade or another relevant discipline. In its absence, 10 years professional experience working on private sector support and export promotion in developing countries.
  • At least 6 years experience on Trade, Standards and/or Private sector support;
  • Experience working with business organisations or producers organisations in Vietnam.
  • In-depth knowledge of at least three value chains in Vietnam. - Strong references on export promotion in Vietnam.
  • Previous experience on EU market access is an advantage.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a multicultural environment
  • Excellent level of English.
  • Good knowledge of Vietnamese.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Lina_Forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Export Promotion Specialist (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation of the ARISE+ Project

On November 3, 2016, the draft Action Document of ARISE+ will be presented to the Quality Support Group of the European Commission Directorate for Development and Cooperation. Comments received during this consultation will be incorporated in a revised draft Action Document that will be made available to and finalised by the experts. A second Quality Support Group will take place tentatively on March 7, 2017 before a final decision on ARISE+ is reached by Q3 of 2017.

The mission’s main objective is to assist the EU Delegation to Vietnam formulate the ARISE+ Programme in Vietnam with a focus on its support to private sector component.

The mission will identify the list of priorities where the programme’s scarce resources should be allocated. This includes the list of sectors most likely to benefit from support to access markets in the EU, with maximum impact on job creation and poverty reduction.

Export Promotion Specialist (Category II) (29 working days)

  • At least a Masters Degree in Economics, Business, Trade or another relevant discipline. In its absence, 10 years professional experience working on private sector support and export promotion in developing countries.
  • At least 6 years experience on Trade, Standards and/or Private sector support;
  • Strong references on export promotion projects and support to producers.
  • Knowledge of value chain management.
  • Good understanding of the European market and market access issues for developing countries.
  • Experience working with business organisations or producers organisations.
  • Experience in South East Asia is an advantage.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a multicultural environment.
  • Excellent level of English.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Lina_Forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Expert in Trade, Standards and/or Private Sector Support (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation of the ARISE+ Project

On November 3, 2016, the draft Action Document of ARISE+ will be presented to the Quality Support Group of the European Commission Directorate for Development and Cooperation. Comments received during this consultation will be incorporated in a revised draft Action Document that will be made available to and finalised by the experts. A second Quality Support Group will take place tentatively on March 7, 2017 before a final decision on ARISE+ is reached by Q3 of 2017.

The mission’s main objective is to assist the EU Delegation to Vietnam formulate the ARISE+ Programme in Vietnam with a focus on its support to private sector component.

The mission will identify the list of priorities where the programme’s scarce resources should be allocated. This includes the list of sectors most likely to benefit from support to access markets in the EU, with maximum impact on job creation and poverty reduction.

Senior Expert in Trade, Standards and/or Private Sector Support (TL) (Category I) (28 working days)

  • At least a Masters Degree in Economics, Business, Trade or another relevant discipline. In its absence, 15 years professional experience working on trade policy in developing countries.
  • At least 12 years’ experience on Trade, Standards and/or Private sector support.
  • Strong references advising policy makers on trade policy in developing countries.
  • Knowledge of sanitary and phytosanitary issues, trade facilitation and quality infrastructure.
  • Good understanding of Free Trade Agreements and Market Access related issues.
  • At least 2 references as Team Leader.
  • Knowledge of EU procedures is an advantage.
  • Experience of formulation of programmes is an advantage.
  • Experience in South East Asia is an advantage.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a multicultural environment
  • Excellent level of English.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Lina_Forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Chef de mission (expert de catégorie 1) – 2eme mission
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Realisation de deux (02) etudes relatives au diagnostic des capacities de la CPS/SDR et de l'interprofession riz du Mali et l'elaboration de plans de renforcement de leurs capacities

Description of the Project:

Les objectifs de la présente mission portent sur la réalisation des deux études suivantes :

  • Étude 1 : Élaboration, sur la base d’un diagnostic approfondi, d’un plan d’action pour le développement des capacités institutionnelles de la CPS/SDR;
  • Étude 2 : Élaboration, sur la base d’un diagnostic approfondi, d’un plan d’action de renforcement des capacités techniques et organisationnelles de l’Interprofession Riz du Mali.

Experience and Qualifications Required:

Niveau universitaire équivalent au moins au Master en économie, agroéconomie, en science sociale ou dans un autre domaine équivalent et disposant des expériences et connaissances suivantes:

  • Avoir au moins 12 ans d’expériences professionnelles dans le renforcement des capacités des organisations faîtières des filières agricoles dont au moins trois ans d’expériences professionnelles spécifiques dans le renforcement des capacités des organisations faîtières des filières agricoles dans les pays de l’Afrique francophones ;
  • avoir réalisé en tant que chef de mission au moins trois missions similaires c'est-àdire des missions portant sur le diagnostic des capacités des interprofessions agricoles assorties de l’élaboration de stratégies pour le développement des capacités de ces interprofessions;
  • avoir des expériences professionnelles ayant des liens avec les filières agricoles au Mali sera un avantage;
  • avoir de solides capacités à communiquer en langue française.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Juriste (expert de catégorie 2) – 2eme mission
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of the Project

Les objectifs de la présente mission portent sur la réalisation des deux études suivantes :

  • Étude 1 : Élaboration, sur la base d’un diagnostic approfondi, d’un plan d’action pour le développement des capacités institutionnelles de la CPS/SDR ;
  • Étude 2 : Élaboration, sur la base d’un diagnostic approfondi, d’un plan d’action de renforcement des capacités techniques et organisationnelles de l’Interprofession Riz du Mali.

Experience and Qualifications Required:

  • Avoir un niveau universitaire équivalent au moins au Master en science juridique;
  • Avoir au moins 6 ans d’expériences professionnelles dans le domaine juridique dont au moins deux ans dans les pays de l’Afrique francophones ;
  • avoir réalisé au moins deux missions similaires c'est-à-dire des missions portant sur l’analyse des cadres juridiques des organisations des filières agricoles et/ou en matière de conseils juridiques aux organisations des filières agricoles;
  • avoir des expériences professionnelles dans le domaine juridique et ayant des liens avec les filières agricoles au Mali sera un avantage ;
  • avoir de solides capacités à communiquer en langue française.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
